sn47.32:4.1: “Mendicants, these four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn47.32:5.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.32:5.3: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.32:5.5: They meditate by observing an aspect of principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.32:5.6: These four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
